article.headline: Hofstra 67, St. Francis, NY 64
article.story: HEMPSTEAD, N.Y. (AP) -- Loren Stokes scored 25 points and Hofstra beat winless St. Francis of New York 67-64 Tuesday night for its sixth straight win. Carlos Rivera added 19 points and Antoine Agudio finished with 15 for the Pride (6-3), who led 35-29 at halftime. Allan Sheppard had 16 points for the Terriers (0-11), who are one of four Division I teams without a win. Iona, Delaware and Southern University are the others. Robert Hines had 15 points and 10 rebounds for St. Francis. Sheppard made a 3 to put the Terriers up 18-16 with 8:23 left in the first half but the Pride responded with an 11-2 run. Zygis Sestokas finished off the surge with a 3-pointer.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.
